definitions.definition: An imitation of something, particularly a well-known product, usually lower in quality and price than the original.
definitions.example: It's not a name-brand bag; it's just a cheap knockoff.

definitions.definition: A device in a knitting machine to remove loops from the needles.
Of or relating to theology.
An indoor arena, having an oval banked track for bicycle racing.
A short preliminary statement or remark, especially an explanatory introduction to a formal document or statute.
A syncword.
To speak or write a preamble; to provide a preliminary statement or set of remarks.
An addictive substance that is seen as relatively harmless by itself, but is believed to encourage the user to experiment with more harmful substances.
(by extension) Any thing or area of interest that tends to lead to deeper involvement.
One who uses body strength instead of intellectual power to earn a wage, usually hourly.
A form of confectionery made by crystallizing sugar around a string.
To land an aircraft or spacecraft.
definitions.example: The plane will touch down in Heathrow at about 2 o'clock.

definitions.definition: To score a touchdown
To score a try.
A feeling of pity for oneself.
Thread or cloth made from flax fiber.
Domestic textiles, such as tablecloths, bedding, towels, underclothes, etc., that are made of linen or linen-like fabrics of cotton or other fibers; linens.
definitions.example: She put the freshly cleaned linens into the linen closet.

definitions.definition: A light beige colour, like that of linen cloth undyed.
Made from linen cloth or thread.
Having the colour linen, light beige.
In an illicit manner; illegally, immorally or inappropriately.
Any viscous liquid or paste, such as a lubricant, used in preparing a surface.
An absorbent material used to hold a liquid.
Any varnish used to coat a part, such as an airplane wing or a hot-air balloon in order to waterproof, strengthen, etc.
Any illicit or narcotic drug that produces euphoria or satisfies an addiction; particularly heroin.
Information, usually from an inside source, originally in horse racing and other sports.
definitions.example: What's the latest dope on the stock market?

definitions.definition: (fireams) Ballistic data on previously fired rounds, used to calculate the required hold over a target.
A stupid person.
Dessert topping.
To affect with drugs.
To treat with dope (lubricant, etc.).
To add a dopant such as arsenic to (a pure semiconductor such as silicon).
To use drugs; especially, to use prohibited performance-enhancing drugs in sporting competitions.
To judge or guess; to predict the result of.
Amazing.
definitions.example: That party was dope!

definitions.definition: Someone being interviewed, i.e. the person answering the questions.
A hard-shelled seed.
definitions.example: There are many sort of nuts: peanuts, cashews, pistachios, Brazil nuts and more.

definitions.definition: A piece of metal, usually square or hexagonal in shape, with a hole through it having machined internal threads, intended to be screwed onto a bolt or other threaded shaft.
A crazy person.
definitions.example: He was driving his car like a nut.

definitions.definition: The head.
Monthly expense to keep a venture running.
The amount of money necessary to set up some venture; set-up costs.
A stash of money owned by an extremely rich investor, sufficient to sustain a high level of consumption if all other money is lost.
On stringed instruments such as guitars and violins, the small piece at the peghead end of the fingerboard that holds the strings at the proper spacing and, in most cases, the proper height.
En, a unit of measurement equal to half of the height of the type in use.
An extravagantly fashionable young man.
(chiefly plural) A testicle.
definitions.example: I kicked him in the nuts.

definitions.definition: Semen, ejaculate.
Orgasm, ejaculation; especially release of semen
definitions.example: He just needs a good nut to make him feel better.

definitions.definition: An extreme enthusiast.
definitions.example: a fashion nut

definitions.definition: A shaped piece of metal, threaded by a wire loop, which is jammed in a crack in the rockface and used to protect a climb. (Originally, machine nuts [sense #2] were used for this purpose.)
(only in attributive use) The best possible hand of a certain type, for instance: "nut straight", "nut flush", and "nut full house". Compare nuts.
definitions.example: nut flush = the best possible flush available

definitions.definition: The tumbler of a gunlock.
A projection on each side of the shank of an anchor, to secure the stock in place.
(mostly in the form "nutting") To gather nuts.
To hit deliberately with the head; to headbutt.
(mildly) To orgasm; to ejaculate.
Insane, mad.
definitions.example: After living on the island alone for five years, he eventually went nuts.

definitions.definition: Crazy, mad; unusually pleased or, alternatively, angered.
definitions.example: I just go nuts over her fantastic desserts.

definitions.definition: Very fond of (on) someone.
definitions.example: He's been nuts on her since the day they met.

definitions.definition: Indicates annoyance, anger, or disappointment.
definitions.example: Nuts! They didn't even listen to what I had to say.

definitions.definition: Signifies rejection of a proposal or idea, as in forget it, no way, or nothing doing; often followed by to.
definitions.example: They want me to pay $5 for a banana? Nuts to that!

definitions.definition: The handling of the ball by the goalkeeper.
Any of very many photosynthetic prokaryotic microorganisms, of phylum Cyanobacteria, once known as blue-green algae.
Anything that is stunning.

A professional wrestling maneuver in which an attacking wrestler applies a facelock to an opponent and falls to a seated position, forcing the opponent's jaw or neck to drop on the attacker's shoulder.
A pistol firing a beam capable of stunning an enemy.
A person or machine that stuns an animal before slaughter.
A non-contagious acute or chronic inflammation of the skin, characterized by redness, itching, and the outbreak of oozing vesicular lesions which become encrusted and scaly.
Bright red in color, like the color of fresh blood.
Something or someone used as a leverage in negotiations.
(leet) Ownage; the act of pwning.
Not explicitly stated; unspoken.
A hard biscuit, flavoured with powdered ginger, often dunked in tea.
A redhead; a ginger-haired person.
Scallion
Better than some other option; preferred.
The first formal, obligatory school. Usually begins with nursery school or first grade and ends at fifth or sixth grade.
definitions.example: The child's mother was tearful as he boarded the bus for his first day of primary school.

definitions.definition: To pay in total a sum which is owed, especially when the sum has been owed for a period of time.
A small European and Asian passerine bird, Prunella modularis; the hedge sparrow or hedge warbler.
The area in front of a petrol station where the petrol pumps are situated.
Any open area in front of a building.
Any of the small organs on the tongue used for tasting.
A number or expression that is to be divided by another.
definitions.example: In "42 ÷ 3" the dividend is the 42.

definitions.definition: A pro rata payment of money by a company to its shareholders, usually made periodically (eg, quarterly or annually).
Beneficial results from a metaphorical investment (of time, effort, etc.)
definitions.example: His 10,000 hours of practice and recitals eventually paid dividends when he become first-chair violinist.

definitions.definition: To faint; to become unconscious
definitions.example: I pass out at the sight of blood.

definitions.definition: To distribute, to hand out
definitions.example: We'll pass out copies of the agenda.

definitions.definition: To graduate from university.
(of soldiers, police, fire-fighters etc.) To graduate, usually marked by the ceremony at the end of their training.
(by extension) To become proficient in a particular job or task
To end (a round) by having passes as the first four bids.
An afterburner.
To heat something after it has cooled off, especially previously cooked food (also in figurative senses).
definitions.example: I’m reheating some leftovers for dinner.

definitions.definition: To become hot again after having cooled off (also in figurative senses).
definitions.example: He put the soup on the stove to reheat.

definitions.definition: Alternative form of rehete
A maneuver which rotates an object end over end.
definitions.example: The diver did a couple of flips before landing in the pool.

definitions.definition: A complete change of direction, decision, movement etc.
A slingshot.
A hairstyle popular among boys in the 1960s–70s and 2000s–10s, in which the hair goes halfway down the ears, at which point it sticks out
definitions.example: Justin Bieber and Zac Efron are among the celebrities who wore a flip.

definitions.definition: The purchase of an asset (usually a house) which is then improved and sold quickly for profit.
To throw so as to turn over.
definitions.example: You need to flip the pancake onto the other side.

definitions.definition: To put into a quick revolving motion through a snap of the thumb and index finger.
definitions.example: If you can't decide which option to go for, flip a coin.

definitions.definition: To win a state (or county) won by another party in the preceding elections
definitions.example: Wisconsin had been Democratic for decades, but the Republicans flipped it in 2016.

definitions.definition: To turn state's evidence; to agree to testify against one's co-conspirators in exchange for concessions from prosecutors.
definitions.example: The mafioso flipped on his superiors to get a lighter sentence.

definitions.definition: To induce someone to turn state's evidence; to get someone to agree to testify against their co-conspirators in exchange for concessions.
definitions.example: The district attorney was able to strengthen his case against the bank robber by flipping the getaway driver.

definitions.definition: To go berserk or crazy.
definitions.example: I'd flip if anyone broke my phone.

definitions.definition: To buy an asset (usually a house), improve it and sell it quickly for profit.
To invert a bit (binary digit), changing it from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0.
Used to express annoyance, especially when the speaker has made an error.
Having the quality of playfulness, or lacking seriousness of purpose.
definitions.example: I hate to be flip, but perhaps we could steal a Christmas tree.

definitions.definition: Sarcastic.
Disrespectful, flippant.
definitions.example: Don't get flip with me or I'll knock you into next Tuesday!

definitions.definition: A mixture of beer, spirit, etc., stirred and heated by a hot iron (a flip dog).
Skill in, and knowledge of, the work of navigating, maintaining, and operating a vessel.
An organisation that gathers and distributes news.
Someone who plays a guitar.
To hit, slap or strike.
To kill, bump off.
To share or parcel out; often with up.
definitions.example: to whack the spoils of a robbery

definitions.definition: To beat convincingly; to thrash.
(usually in the negative) To surpass; to better.
Tired; fatigued.
definitions.example: After that all-night party, we were all whacked.

definitions.definition: Intoxicated on drugs.
A GUI widget that allows the user to select one or more items from a list contained within a static, multiple line text box.
Not rounded.
A torn-up piece of turf, especially by a golf club in making a stroke or by a horse's hoof.
A disruption in an otherwise smooth contour.
A polynomial with two terms.
A quantity expressed as the sum or difference of two terms.
A scientific name at the rank of species, with two terms: a generic name and a specific name.
Consisting of two terms, or parts.
Of or relating to the binomial distribution.
Trouble; misery; a feeling of disquiet or concern.
To make uneasy or uncomfortable
A bunch of cut flowers.
definitions.example: For my birthday I received two bouquets.

definitions.definition: The scent of a particular wine.
definitions.example: This Bordeaux has an interesting bouquet.

definitions.definition: The heart note of a perfume.
definitions.example: The remarkable flower bouquet lasts for hours until it dissolves into a sweet vanilla smell.

definitions.definition: A compliment or expression of praise.
A bouquet of circles.
The reserve of cards in the game of Flower Garden and variations.
The ninth Lenormand card, sometimes called Flowers instead.
A being originating from outside of the Earth's atmosphere, from space, or from another planet; an alien
Originating from outside of the Earth's atmosphere, from space, or from another planet; alien to Earth or its environment.
A seemingly fierce or powerful person, country or organisation without the ability to back up their words; apparently powerful but actually ineffective.
The control or domination by a powerful country over weaker ones (especially former colonies) by the use of economic pressure, political suppression and cultural dominance.
A soundproof room or building used for the production of movies or of television programmes.
Abbreviation of million.
Thousand
Make
Of or pertaining to the male gender; manly.
Of or pertaining to the male sex; biologically male, not female.
Belonging to males; typically used by males.
definitions.example: “John”, “Paul” and “Jake” are masculine names.

definitions.definition: Having the qualities stereotypically associated with men: virile, aggressive, not effeminate.
(grammar) Of, pertaining or belonging to the male grammatical gender, in languages that have gender distinctions.
A prescribed quantity or extent.
The act or result of measuring.
Metrical rhythm.
A course of action.
(always meter) A device that measures things.
(always meter) A parking meter or similar device for collecting payment.
(always meter) One who metes or measures.
definitions.example: a labouring coal-meter

definitions.definition: (elsewhere metre) The base unit of length in the International System of Units (SI), conceived of as 1/10000000 of the distance from the North Pole to the Equator, and now defined as the distance light will travel in a vacuum in 1/299792458 second.
(elsewhere metre) An increment of music; the overall rhythm; particularly, the number of beats in a measure.
(elsewhere metre) The rhythm pattern in a poem.
(elsewhere metre) A line above or below a hanging net, to which the net is attached in order to strengthen it.
A poem.
The international mile: a unit of length precisely equal to 1.609344 kilometers established by treaty among Anglophone nations in 1959, divided into 5,280 feet or 1,760 yards.
Any of several customary units of length derived from the 1593 English statute mile of 8 furlongs, equivalent to 5,280 feet or 1,760 yards of various precise values.
Any of many customary units of length derived from the Roman mile (mille passus) of 8 stades or 5,000 Roman feet.
The Scandinavian mile: a unit of length precisely equal to 10 kilometers defined in 1889.
Any of many customary units of length from other measurement systems of roughly similar values, as the Chinese (里) or Arabic mile (al-mīl).
(travel) An airline mile in a frequent flier program.
Any similarly large distance.
definitions.example: The shot missed by a mile.

definitions.definition: A race of 1 mile's length; a race of around 1 mile's length (usually 1500 or 1600 meters)
definitions.example: The runners competed in the mile.

definitions.definition: One mile per hour, as a measure of speed.
definitions.example: five miles over the speed limit

definitions.definition: A half note, drawn as a semibreve with a stem.
A unit of volume, in the Imperial and U.S. customary systems, 1/60 fluid drachm. Approximately equal to 1 drop, 62 μL or 0.9 grain (weight) of water.
A short vertical stroke used in handwriting.
Anything very minute; applied to animalcula and the like.
definitions.example: the minims of existence

definitions.definition: The smallest kind of worker in a leaf-cutter ant colony.
A little man or being; a dwarf.
A small fish; a minnow.
A short poetical encomium.
A unit of time equal to sixty seconds (one-sixtieth of an hour).
definitions.example: You have twenty minutes to complete the test.

definitions.definition: A short but unspecified time period.
definitions.example: Wait a minute, I’m not ready yet!

definitions.definition: A unit of angle equal to one-sixtieth of a degree.
definitions.example: We need to be sure these maps are accurate to within one minute of arc.

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the plural, minutes) A (usually formal) written record of a meeting or a part of a meeting.
definitions.example: Let’s look at the minutes of last week’s meeting.

definitions.definition: A unit of purchase on a telephone or other network, especially a cell phone network, roughly equivalent in gross form to sixty seconds' use of the network.
definitions.example: If you buy this phone, you’ll get 100 free minutes.

definitions.definition: A point in time; a moment.
A nautical or a geographic mile.
An old coin, a half farthing.
A very small part of anything, or anything very small; a jot; a whit.
A fixed part of a module.
A while or a long unspecified period of time
definitions.example: Oh, I ain't heard that song in a minute!

definitions.definition: A period into which a year is divided, historically based on the phases of the moon.
definitions.example: July is my favourite month.

definitions.definition: A period of 30 days, 31 days, or some alternation thereof.
definitions.example: We went on holiday for two months.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) A woman's period; menstrual discharge.
The hand of a clock or watch face that revolves once each hour and indicates the minutes.
A person who swindles, cheats or defrauds.

A hypothesis set up to be nullified or refuted in order to support an alternative hypothesis. When used, the null hypothesis is presumed true until statistical evidence in the form of a hypothesis test indicates otherwise. Therefore, the null and the alternative hypothesis must be mutually exclusive and exhaustive.
A good character in a story, often a hero.
Expression of pleasure; yippee.
A hinged board or hatch at the rear of a vehicle that can be lowered for loading and unloading; a tailboard.
The hinged rear door of a hatchback.
Either of the downstream gates in a canal lock.
To drive dangerously close behind another vehicle.
definitions.example: That idiot has been tailgating me for the last five minutes.

definitions.definition: To follow another person through access control on their access, rather than on one’s own credentials, especially when entering a door controlled by a card reader.
(of a broker) To privately purchase or sell a security immediately after trading in the same security for a client.
To have a tailgate party.
A litigant or party that is making an appeal in court
definitions.example: The appellant made her submissions to the court.

definitions.definition: One who makes an earnest entreaty of any kind.
One who challenges another to single combat.
One of the clergy in the Jansenist controversy who rejected the bull Unigenitus issued in 1713, appealing to a pope "better informed", or to a general council.
Of or relating to appeals; appellate
In the process of appealing
A toy made of a soft material, usually stuffed with cotton, straw, beans, or other materials, and typically intended as a plaything for children.
Poorly ventilated; partially plugged.
definitions.example: I can’t smell very well today – I have a stuffy nose.

definitions.definition: Stout; mettlesome; resolute.
Angry and obstinate; sulky.
Boring, uninteresting, over-formal, pompous, very conventional.
definitions.example: The stuffy professor droned on as the class lost interest.

definitions.definition: Stout; sturdy.
The blundering use of an absurdly inappropriate word or expression in place of a similar-sounding one.
definitions.example: The script employed malapropism to great effect.

definitions.definition: An instance of this; malaprop.
definitions.example: The humor comes from all the malapropisms.

definitions.definition: Someone who presents a television programme of videos; a video jockey.
To work as a video jockey; to present videos.
Vagina, vulva.

The transversal part of a church, which crosses at right angles to the greatest length, and between the nave and choir. In the basilicas, this had often no projection at its two ends. In Gothic churches these project greatly, and should be called the arms of the transept. It is common, however, to speak of the arms themselves as the transepts.
Ground, spiced meat that can be stuffed in a sausage or used as a sausage patty.
The process of developing something anew.
definitions.example: the redevelopment of the hero's character in a comic book

definitions.definition: The demolition of old, redundant or unfashionable buildings or infrastructure and the construction of new ones on the same site.
A maid who handles the chores in a bedroom.

A hand tool with a handle, used for moving portions of material such as earth, snow, and grain from one place to another, with some forms also used for digging. Not to be confused with a spade, which is designed solely for small-scale digging and incidental tasks such as chopping of small roots.
A spade.
To move materials with a shovel.
definitions.example: After the blizzard, we shoveled the driveway for the next two days.

definitions.definition: To move with a shoveling motion.
definitions.example: Already late for work, I shovelled breakfast into my mouth as fast as possible.

definitions.definition: A male peafowl, especially Pavo cristatus, notable for its brilliant iridescently ocellated tail.
A peafowl (of the genus Pavo or Afropavo), either male or female.
A vainglorious person .
Any of various Asian species of papilionid butterflies of the genus Papilio.
To strut about proudly.
To engage in peacocking, ostentatious dress or behaviour to impress women.
A slate or enamel board for writing on with chalk; a predecessor to a whiteboard.
A place where voters go to cast their ballot in an election or referendum; a voting station
Kind and well-intentioned.
One involved in the formulation of policies, especially politicians, lobbyists, and activists.
A scene that is filmed again, or a picture that is photographed again
An instance of resitting an examination
To take something again
To take something back
To capture or occupy somewhere again
definitions.example: The army tried repeatedly to retake the fort they had been driven from.

definitions.definition: To photograph or film again
A vehicle used in farms e.g. for pulling farm equipment and preparing the fields.
A truck (or lorry) for pulling a semi-trailer or trailer.
Any piece of machinery that pulls something.
An airplane where the propeller is located in front of the fuselage
(rail transportation) A British Rail Class 37 locomotive.
A metal rod used in tractoration, or Perkinism.
To prepare (land) with a tractor.
To move with a tractor beam.
To treat by means of tractoration, or Perkinism.
To blacken or make dirty with soot.
Of, relating to, or producing soot.
Soiled with soot
Of the color of soot.
Dark-skinned; black.
(often in the passive) To place (something) at an angle.
definitions.example: The roof is angled at 15 degrees.

definitions.definition: To change direction rapidly.
definitions.example: The five ball angled off the nine ball but failed to reach the pocket.

definitions.definition: To present or argue something in a particular way or from a particular viewpoint.
definitions.example: How do you want to angle this when we talk to the client?

definitions.definition: (cue sports) To hamper (oneself or one's opponent) by leaving the cue ball in the jaws of a pocket such that the surround of the pocket (the "angle") blocks the path from cue ball to object ball.
To try to catch fish with a hook and line.
(with for) To attempt to subtly persuade someone to offer a desired thing.
definitions.example: He must be angling for a pay rise.

definitions.definition: A form of fishing, with a rod, line and angle (hook) for recreation or sport.
One who is capable of adapting to differing situations.
definitions.example: He was an able adapter, and could easily adjust to the differences when the company changed ownership.

definitions.definition: One who adapts a thing, e.g. a play.
definitions.example: The critic gave rave reviews to the adapter of the ancient play, who worked to give the text more relevance to the modern day.

definitions.definition: A device or application used to achieve operative compatibility between devices that otherwise are incompatible.
definitions.example: He had an adapter that let him plug his phone into the car's cigarette lighter for power.

definitions.definition: The goodwill, sympathy, and connections created by social interaction within and between social networks.
The value created by social relationships, with expected returns in the marketplace.
The complete set of unique alleles that would be found by inspecting the genetic material of every living member of a species or population.
A sound made by loose objects shaking or vibrating against one another.
definitions.example: I wish they would fix the rattle under my dashboard.

definitions.definition: A baby’s toy designed to make sound when shaken, usually containing loose grains or pellets in a hollow container.
A device that makes a rattling sound such as put on an animal so its location can be heard.
A musical instrument that makes a rattling sound.
Noisy, rapid talk.
Trivial chatter; gossip.
A noisy, senseless talker; a jabberer.
A scolding; a sharp rebuke.
Any organ of an animal having a structure adapted to produce a rattling sound.
definitions.example: The rattle of the rattlesnake is composed of the hardened terminal scales, loosened in succession, but not cast off, and modified in form so as to make a series of loose, hollow joints.

definitions.definition: The noise produced in the throat by air passing through mucus which the lungs struggle to clear.
The noise in the throat produced by the air in passing through mucus which the lungs are unable to expel - sometimes occurs as a person nears death; death rattle.
Any plant of the genus Rhinanthus, whose seeds produce a rattling noise in the wind.
To create a rattling sound by shaking or striking.
definitions.example: Rattle the can of cat treats if you need to find Fluffy.

definitions.definition: To scare, startle, unsettle, or unnerve.
To make a rattling noise; to make noise by or from shaking.
definitions.example: I wish the dashboard in my car would quit rattling.

definitions.definition: To assail, annoy, or stun with a ratting noise.
To scold; to rail at.
To drive or ride briskly, so as to make a clattering.
definitions.example: We rattled along for a couple of miles.

definitions.definition: To make a clatter with one's voice; to talk rapidly and idly; often with on or away.
definitions.example: She rattled on for an hour.

definitions.definition: A former Middle Eastern and North African unit of dry weight, usually between 1–5 pounds (0.5–2.5 kg).
A feeling of general bodily discomfort, fatigue or unpleasantness, often at the onset of illness.
An ambiguous feeling of mental or moral depression.
Ill will or hurtful feelings for others or someone.
A scholarly book or a treatise on a single subject or a group of related subjects, usually written by one person.
To write a monograph on (a subject).
Of the FDA: to publish a standard that authorizes the use of (a substance).
In a confident manner; with confidence; with strong assurance; positively.
